main event: On April 7, 1969, a civilian observer sighted a bright light heading north, with a leading piece breaking off during the observation. The total length of the observation was several minutes.
interesting points: The first sighting lasted about 5 seconds while the second sighting lasted about 3 minutes, A probe or crane-like extension was observed coming out of the object, The witness used a telescope to confirm the presence of two objects that were very bright, The objects fluctuated in magnitude as they moved, The observer reported physical evidence related to the sighting.
witness description: The witness is an amateur astronomer, age 42, male, with no relevant prior experiences mentioned.
